intro: Baccharis tetroica, commonly known as sweet goldenrod, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow inflorescences that appear in late summer and early fall. The plant has aromatic leaves that release a sweet scent when crushed, contributing to its common name. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Baccharis tetroica plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife due to its nectar-rich flowers.
